citation.article-title: Demequina globuliformis sp. nov., Demequina oxidasica sp. nov. and Demequina aurantiaca sp. nov., actinobacteria isolated from marine environments, and proposal of Demequinaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Demequinaceae (De.me.qui.na′ce.a.e. N.L. fem. n. Demequina type genus of the family, -aceae ending to denote a family: N.L. fem. pl. n. Demequinaceae the Demequina family).

On the basis of 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis and combinations of genotypic, phenotypic and chemotaxonomic characteristics, the family is a member of the suborder Micrococcineae with the following nucleotide sequence characteristics: 120 (A), 131 : 231 (C–G), 196 (A), 342 : 347 (C–G), 444 : 490 (A–U), 580 : 761 (C–G), 602 : 636 (C–G), 670 : 736 (A–U), 822 : 878 (G–C), 823 : 877 (G–C), 826 : 874 (C–G), 827 (U), 843 (U), 950 : 1231 (U–A), 1047 : 1210 (G–C), 1109 (C), 1145 (G), 1309 : 1328 (G–C), 1361 (G) and 1383 (C).
The predominant quinone is demethylmenaquinone DMK-9(H4).
